intro: Preslaea paradoxa, commonly known as the paradox plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its unique, spiky leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the island's arid climate. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying plant adaptations. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
